question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane that created dangerous conditions at beaches along much of the East Coast this week, even though it remained well offshore?
evidence: Hurricane Erin, one of the fastest-strengthening Atlantic hurricanes on record, made its closest approach to the North Carolina coast on Thursday as a Category 2 storm.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump this week pledged to “lead a movement” to get rid of which of the following?
evidence: In a post on his social media site this week, the president claimed that “The US is the only country in the world that uses mail-in voting because all of the others gave it up due to ‘MASSIVE VOTER FRAUD.’” That claim is false. Dozens of other countries use mail-in voting — including Canada, the UK, Germany, Australia and Switzerland.

question_sentence: According to a new poll, how are residents of Washington, DC, feeling now that President Trump has mobilized National Guard troops on city streets?
evidence: More than 60% of respondents said they feel less safe now. And roughly 8 in 10 DC residents oppose the president’s emergency crime crackdown and the deployment of the National Guard and the FBI to patrol the city.

question_sentence: The Department of Homeland Security plans to do which of the following to deter undocumented immigrants from climbing the wall along the southern border?
choices: Build guard towers with water cannons
Dig a moat and fill it with alligators
evidence: The wall along the southern border will be painted black in an effort to make the structure too hot to climb, Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced Tuesday, saying the suggestion came from President Trump.

question_sentence: More than 750 current and former staffers at the Department of Health and Human Services signed a letter imploring Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to do which of the following?
choices: Publicly disavow false and misleading claims about vaccines
Guarantee the safety of the HHS workforce
evidence: The staffers blamed a deadly attack on the CDC headquarters earlier this month on “growing mistrust in public institutions, driven by politicized rhetoric that has turned public health professionals from trusted experts into targets of villainization — and now, violence.”

question_sentence: Which telecommunications company has agreed to settle claims related to data breaches in 2024?
evidence: Millions of AT&T customers can file claims worth up to $7,500 in cash payments as part of a $177 million settlement.

question_sentence: The Air Canada strike came to an end this week after the airline made a tentative deal with which group of employees?
evidence: The flight attendants were seeking wage increases and paid compensation for work when planes are grounded, and as they perform critical safety checks, attend to onboard medical and safety emergencies, and assist passengers with boarding and deplaning.

question_sentence: The FDA issued a warning this week about certain bags of frozen shrimp sold at Walmart for which of the following reasons?
choices: The bags contained scallops, not shrimp
evidence: The FDA said that a radioactive isotope, cesium-137, was detected in a sample of breaded shrimp detained at US ports from an Indonesian supplier named BMS Foods.

question_sentence: Which movie does director Quentin Tarantino think is his best?
evidence: During a podcast interview, Tarantino said “Inglourious Basterds” was his best piece of work, while his favorite was “Once Upon a Time… in Hollywood.”

question_sentence: A 10-year-old British girl recently made history when she became the youngest to accomplish which of the following?
choices: Become the youngest female chess player to defeat a grandmaster
evidence: Bodhana Sivanandan, from northwest London, recently defeated 60-year-old grandmaster Pete Wells in the final round of the 2025 British Chess Championships.
